moves.5... bxc6 6. dxe5 Bg4 7. Bf4: He was going to take my Knight then take my e5 pawn. I put the Bishop there to protect it.
moves.7... Bxf3 8. Qxf3 Rb8: Wanting to attack my Queen side.
moves.9. Qc3: My Queen is protecting the b2 pawn and the e5 pawn and attacking the c6 pawn.
moves.9... c5 10. Na3 c6 11. O-O-O d5 12. e6: If the d pawn takes my e4 pawn Rook takes Queen. Here I pushed e6 to allow my Bishop to attack his Rook.
moves.12... Rc8 13. exf7+ Kxf7 14. Qf3: Wanting to put my Bishop on c7 with check.
If only I could move my Rook to d4 sooner.
moves.20. Qg4+ Kf7 21. Qg7+ Ke6 22. Rde1+ Kd7: I took here because I got the Bishop out of the way.
moves.24... Kxe7 25. Re1+: If he went King f7 I would checkmate him with Queen g7.
moves.25... Kd6 26. Qe6+ Kc5 27. Be3+ d4 28. Q: By now you should be able to see checkmate. King b8 Queen a7 checkmate. If Black puts his Queen on d7, I would put my Rook on e7 pinning the Queen to the King.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C62), old Steinitz defence, Nimzovich attack
